page.title: 18FLOODING-CAMELS' AREA CONT'D
page.content: The greatest amount of flood damage to property occurs at West Camel.Here the river will be widened,deepened and straightened.A low wall will be built to prevent flooding to houses backing on to the river. Flooding in Urgashay occurs when water is forced from the water course at an acute bend to the east, and flows across the field to the hamlet.Channel works will be carried out at the bend, and the channel re-aligned, with the existing bend being retained.The excavated material will be used to embank the river. At Brigdehampton flood waters following natural depressions,flow to the road and then into the hamlet.A low grassed bank is to be constructed here.
